poem:
**Breaking News**

Live feed cut,
microphone severed, 
truth tangled in its coil —
a dance of mouths and furrowed brows,
where silence spoke louder.
Words like jagged glass,
thrown, never caught.
Echoes of fractured screens,
the debate yet begun,
already broken.
Network's heartbeat skips,
a moment,
unheard, unseen.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "CNN abruptly ends live interview after Trump spokesperson criticizes network CNN abruptly terminated a live interview with Donald Trump’s spokesperson on Monday after she criticised the two journalists whom the network chose to moderate the much anticipated upcoming debate between the former president and Joe Biden. Karoline Leavitt, the Trump campaign national press secretary, became embroiled in a heated exchange with Kasie Hunt, the presenter of CNN This Morning, after saying Trump would be entering". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: CNN abruptly ends live interview after Trump spokesperson criticizes network CNN abruptly terminated a live interview with Donald Trump’s spokesperson on Monday after she criticised the two journalists whom the network chose to moderate the much anticipated upcoming debate between the former president and Joe Biden. Karoline Leavitt, the Trump campaign national press secretary, became embroiled in a heated exchange with Kasie Hunt, the presenter of CNN This Morning, after saying Trump would be entering
